intro: Aspalathus linearifolia, commonly known as Rooibos, is a small shrub native to the Western Cape of South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is well adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate, thriving in dry, sandy soils. Its most notable feature is its unique red-colored leaves, which are used to produce the popular herbal tea. The plant has a long history of traditional use and is now widely cultivated for commercial purposes.
